free_txt: VM

bib_record.title: Proton elastic scattering from 40,42,44,48Ca at 800 MeV

free_txt: LAMPF.
Cross section data were measured in 1st experiment for
40,42,44,48Ca and reported in Phys.Lett. B81, 151.
Cross section data for 40Ca from 3-16 degrees and 42Ca
from 3-12 degrees were remeasured in a 2nd experiment
(Exp 311/cycle 22).
Data above 12 degrees from first experiment were then
normalized to 42Ca data from 2nd experiment and a
normalization factor 1.10 was obtained. 42,44,48Ca and
40Ca above 16 degrees from the earlier experiment were
then renormalized by this factor.
For analyzing power data from 1st experiment, scatterin
angles were all shifted by 0.02 degrees(c.m.) based on
analysis of data from 2nd measurement.
High resolution spectrometer.
In 1st experiment, beam monitored using ionization
chamber located inside scattering chamber downstream
from the target, and for angles greater than 12
degrees, by a secondary emission monitor located
downstream from the target.
In the 2nd experiment, beam current monitored by 3
ionization chambers located inside scattering chamber,
downstream from the target.
No information on source of uncertainties
given.
LAMPF.
Beam polarization typically 87%.
Incident energies 796+-2 MeV for 1st experiment and
800+-0.5 MeV for 2nd experiment.
Data received by email from L. Ray, 12 November 1999.
Approved by L. Ray, 24 Nov 1999.
